thread.title: Kansas crushed by No. 3 Baylor in 7-66 loss
thread.title_full: Kansas crushed by No. 3 Baylor in 7-66 loss - KCTV5

author: Posted by Laura McCallister, Multimedia Producer
title: Kansas crushed by No. 3 Baylor in 7-66 loss
text:
LAWRENCE, KS (FOOTBALLKC) - The over/under for the Kansas vs. Baylor game was set at 44 points prior to kickoff, and by halftime the Bears already had that covered.
Baylor moved to 5-0 on the season and Kansas fell to 0-5 as the Jayhawks suffered a blowout 66-7 loss to the No. 3 team in the country.
The Baylor starters only played the first half, as backup quarterback Jarrett Stidham took over for Heisman candidate Seth Russell, and the two combined for five touchdowns and 363 yards.
Baylor also gashed the Kansas defense on the ground as Shock Linwood took 13 carries for 135 yards and touchdown, part of 281 yards total for the Bears in the run game.
The Kansas running game was nowhere near as successful, as top running back Ke’aun Kinner only had two carries for six carries, with Taylor Cox taking the bulk of KU’s opportunities, rushing for 45 yards on 19 carries.
At quarterback Ryan Willis made his first career start and at times showed signs of potential, en route to 158-yard day. He did throw one interception but also connected with Steven Sims Jr. for the Jayhawks only score on the day.
In just the first 30 minutes, the undefeated Bears racked up 425 yards total, 298 of which came in the first quarter. Out of Baylor’s seven first-half scoring drives, none of them took more than two minutes and 16 seconds.
Things got even worse in Lawrence when 410-pound tight end LaQuan McGowan stumbled into the end zone for an 18-yard score, to give the Bears a 38-7 advantage.
Kansas did show life to start the game as Willis’ touchdown drive came right after Baylor’s first score, but the momentum was short lived as Kansas showed they had no answer for the Baylor offense.
The Jayhawks will look to find more answers on both sides of the ball next week when they host a slightly easier opponent, the Texas Tech Red Raiders. Kick-off is set for 11 a.m. central time in Lawrence.
